suncertify.common

Class AppConfigManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.common.AppConfigManager

  • public class AppConfigManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The AppConfigManager class is a singleton that serves as the sole manager of all configuration parameters. It is a wrapper for a Properties object.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Augustine Ogundimu
    See Also:
    Properties

      private static AppConfigManager instance
      Reference to only instance of this class.
      private java.util.logging.Logger logger
      This is a reference to a Logger object.
      private java.util.Properties properties
      A reference to the Properties object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private AppConfigManager()
      A private default constructor to ensure that the only instance of this class is accessed through the getInstance() method.

      • logger

        private final java.util.logging.Logger logger
        This is a reference to a Logger object. The logger's name is the fully qualitified name for this class.

      • instance

        Reference to only instance of this class. Access to this is through a call to the getInstance() method.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AppConfigManager

        private AppConfigManager()
                  throws AppConfigException
        A private default constructor to ensure that the only instance of this class is accessed through the getInstance() method.
        Throws:
        AppConfigException - is thrown if an error is encountered while accessing the properties file.
        See Also:
        getInstance()

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static AppConfigManager getInstance()
                                    throws AppConfigException
        This method provides access to the single instance of this class.
        Returns:
        A reference to the single instance of this class.
        Throws:
        AppConfigException - If an error is encountered during the construction of the instance.

      • get

        public java.lang.String get(java.lang.String key)
        This method returns A String denoting the configuration parameter with the specified key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key associated with the configuration parameter.
        Returns:
        A String denoting the value of the parameter or null if a configuration parameter with the key was not found.

      • set

        public void set(java.lang.String key,
                java.lang.String value)
         throws AppConfigException
        This method sets the configuration parameter associated with the specified key to the provided value
        Parameters:
        key - The key associated with the configuration parameter.
        value - The new value for the configuration parameter.
        Throws:
        AppConfigException - If there was an error accessing the the configuration properties file.
